solution_line_template: She mowed lawns for {mowing_hours_september} hours in September, so earned {mowing_hours_september} * ${mowing_rate}= $<<{mowing_hours_september}*{mowing_rate}={earned_mowing_september}>>{earned_mowing_september}.

She pulled weeds for {weeding_hours_september} hours in September, so earned {weeding_hours_september} * ${weeding_rate}= $<<{weeding_hours_september}*{weeding_rate}={earned_weeding_september}>>{earned_weeding_september}.
Finally, for two months working the same hours she earned ${total_earned_september} * {num_months} = $<<{total_earned_september}*{num_months}={total_earned_two_months}>>{total_earned_two_months}.
